Have you tried decoupling as much as possible? That makes testing a
heck of a lot easier!

-jason

-----Original Message-----
From: drc@... [mailto:drc@...]
Sent: Tuesday, November 20, 2001 6:17 AM
To: junit@yahoogroups.com
Subject: [junit] Testing complex system with JUnit


Hi all,
I need your advice in testing complex system with JUnit (I know that
this isn't the primary purpose of JUnit :)).

First question:
For example, I want test class (instance of class) with links to many
other classes (which have linsk to other classes etc.).
I can:
a) create real instances of all classes participating in system and
create links to each other. This can be very complex task for testing
only one method, I don't want make this work.
or
b) create some fake classes with expected behaviour and offers its to
tested class. But with linsk from tested class to instances to many
diferent classes (with many methods), creating this fake classes can
be very complex too.

Is there some other way or have you some experiences with testing
classes with links to many instances of other classes? Any clue? :)

Second question:
If I have complex system and must test it (simulate real load,
stress ...), which is the best way to do this, especialy how I
recognize expected status of system after tests and compare it to
result?

Thanx

Zdenek Smid
